channel.title: Brisbane s calendar Light up Brisbane
channel.description: This calendar includes scheduled lights ups of Council assets including Story Bridge, Reddacliff Place sculptures, Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City Hall, King George Square, William Jolly Bridge and Tropical Dome at Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha.

item.title: Brisbane Comedy Festival
item.description:
Sunday, April 28, 2024

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Yellow to support Brisbane Comedy Festival.

Brisbane Comedy Festival presented by Brisbane Powerhouse is an annual month-long event showcasing over 135 acts in over 300 events across four venues. Brisbane Comedy Festival is designed to bring a program of entertainment and attraction to Brisbane's event calendar.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Powerhouse

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: World Wish Day
item.description:
Monday, April 29, 2024

City Hall will be lit Blue to support World Wish Day.

Make-A-Wish Australia will be celebrating World Wish Day, a day that marks the first ever wish granted by Make-A-Wish US in 1980. In Australia we celebrate the day with ‘Wear It Blue To Make Wishes Come True’ – where we encourage all Australians to wear blue to show their support for wishes and all of the inspirational people who help make them come true.

This Light Up is organised by: Make-A-Wish Australia

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Eve of Lyme Disease Awareness Day
item.description:
Tuesday, April 30, 2024

The Tropical Dome will be lit Green to support Eve of Lyme Disease Awareness Day.

May 1 is Lyme Disease Awareness Day. May is also Lyme Disease Awareness Month. Lyme Disease is a bacterial infection caused by a spiral shaped bacterium, Borrelia burgdorferi. It is commonly contracted by a tick bite, though other methods and vectors of transmission are possible. The Lyme Disease Association of Australia runs a campaign throughout May to raise awareness and support patients of Lyme and other tick-borne diseases.

The Lyme Disease Association of Australia is a small yet powerful registered charity and Australia’s peak patient body. We are committed to achieving universal recognition and equitable treatment for Australian Lyme and associated disease patients. We raise awareness of the potential dangers of tick bites, support patients 24/7, and liaise with parliamentarians to work for positive change regarding access to diagnosis, treatment and financial support.

This Light Up is organised by: Lyme Disease Assn of Australia Inc

Venue: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha
Venue address: Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha, 152 Mt Coot-tha Road, Toowong

item.title: Domestic Violence Remembrance Day and Candlelight Vigil
item.description:
Wednesday, May 1, 2024

The Tropical Dome will be lit Purple to support Domestic Violence Remembrance Day and Candlelight Vigil.

In partnership with the Brisbane Domestic Violence Service the Zonta Club of Brisbane East will undertake an intergenerational event to highlight the impact of domestic and family violence on women aged 18 and before to 80 plus. The event coincides with the first day of DV and FV day commemorating lives lost to domestic violence.

This Light Up is organised by: Zonta Club of Brisbane East Inc and Brisbane Domestic Violence Services

Venue: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha
Venue address: Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha, 152 Mt Coot-tha Road, Toowong

item.title: Domestic and Family Violence Prevention Month
item.description:
Thursday, May 2, 2024

The Reddacliff Place sculptureswill be lit Purple to support Domestic and Family Violence Prevention Month.

Domestic and Family Violence Prevention Month is an annual sector-led initiative held each May to continue to raise awareness of domestic and family violence and coercive control. The initiative aims to build community awareness of domestic and family violence and coercive control, and mobilise corporate and community action to end domestic and family violence in Queensland.

This Light Up is organised by: Queensland Government

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: International Huntington's Month
item.description:
Friday, May 3, 2024

City Hall will be lit Blue and Purple to support International Huntington's Month.

May is international Huntington's awareness month which includes a campaign #LightItUp4HD in which landmark buildings and bridges are lit up around the world in blue and purple lights, respectively representing Huntington's disease (HD) and Juvenile Huntington's disease (JHD). Huntington's is a neuro-degenerative disorder that is fatal and incurable and affects about 7-10 per 100,000 Australians.

Huntington’s Australia, the peak national body for Huntington’s disease, is dedicated to improving the quality of life for individuals and families impacted by HD. Through our comprehensive range of services, we strive to raise awareness, advocate for the HD community, and provide vital training and education to caregivers, disability support service providers, allied health professionals and other stakeholders.

This Light Up is organised by: Huntington's Australia

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

Huntington's is a neuro-degenerative disorder that is fatal and incurable and affects about 7-10 per 100,000 Australians.

Huntington’s Australia, the peak national body for Huntington’s disease, is dedicated to improving the quality of life for individuals and families impacted by HD. Through our comprehensive range of services, we strive to raise awareness, advocate for the HD community, and provide vital training and education to caregivers, disability support service providers, allied health professionals and other stakeholders.

This Light Up is organised by: Huntington's Australia

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Foster and Kinship Carer Week
item.description:
Tuesday, May 7, 2024

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Pink to support Foster and Kinship Carer Week.

Foster and Kinship Carer Week is held annually from Saturday of the Labour Day long weekend in May to the following Saturday. In 2024, it will run from 4-11 May. During the week we say thanks to more than 6,000 foster and kinship carer families in Queensland for their dedication and commitment Thank you for opening your hearts and homes to children and young people in need. The week is an opportunity for everyone to acknowledge the valuable role they play in our communities.

Life without Barriers is a not-for-profit, Australia Wide social purpose organisation whose overarching purpose is to partner with people to change lives for the better. We provide services across several community sectors, including foster care.

This Light Up is organised by: Life Without Barriers

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

item.title: International Thalassaemia Day
item.description:
Wednesday, May 8, 2024

The Story Bridge will be lit Red to support International Thalassaemia Day.

Celebrated on the 8th of May, International Thalassaemia Day is devoted to raising awareness amongst the general public and decision-makers about thalassaemia, promoting and strengthening the lifelong and difficult struggle of patients against this severe blood condition. It commemorates all the people who are no longer with us, while renewing our promise to keep fighting until the final cure for thalassaemia is found.

This Light Up is organised by: Thalassemia and Sickle Cell Australia

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

item.description:
Thursday, May 9, 2024

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Blue to support Do It For Dolly Day.

Do It For Dolly Day is a day dedicated to bringing the community together, spreading kindness and uniting in helping break the silence around bullying. Dolly's Dream is committed to changing the culture of bullying by addressing the impact of bullying, anxiety, depression, and youth suicide, through education and direct support to young people and families.

This Light Up is organised by: Dolly's Dream

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

item.title: ME/CFS/MF Awareness Week
item.description:
Sunday, May 12, 2024

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Blue to support ME/CFS/MF Awareness Week.

ME/CFS/FM Support Association Qld Inc., helps sufferers of Myalgic Encephalomyelitis/Chronic Fatigue Syndrome and Fibromyalgia (ME/CFS/FM) by spreading awareness and sending them free information kits as well as having support groups meetings and a Facebook page. Its Annual International ME/CFS/FM Awareness Week which is celebrated all around the world to spread awareness on how debilitating ME/CFS and Fibromyalgia are.

This Light Up is organised by: ME/CFS/FM Support Association Qld Inc

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Eve of 2024 Apraxia Speech Awareness Day
item.description:
Monday, May 13, 2024

The Reddacliff Place sculptureswill be lit Blue to support Eve of 2024 Apraxia Speech Awareness Day.

Childhood Apraxia of Speech has an international awareness day on May 14 aiming to raise awareness of apraxia. Knowledge is power & our children with apraxia & their families/teachers/communities need to learn more & become more aware.

Childhood apraxia of speech is a type of speech disorder that is present from birth. A child with this condition has problems making sounds correctly and consistently, as it is a problem with the motor coordination of speech.

This Light Up is organised by: Keys to Communicate Speech Pathology

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Light the Way
item.description:
Tuesday, May 14, 2024

The Story Bridge will be lit Blue to support Light the Way.

TSA (Tuberous Sclerosis Australia) aims to raise awareness of and provide support and education for people living with or affected by Tuberous Sclerosis Complex (TSC). The annual Light the Way Campaign raises awareness of Tuberous Sclerosis Complex (TSC) and raises funds for the Nursing Service through which TSA (Tuberous Sclerosis Australia) provides support to those living with and affected by TSC.

This Light Up is organised by: Tuberous Sclerosis Inc

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

item.title: Women's State Of Origin Game I and NRL Magic Round
item.description:
Wednesday, May 15, 2024

The Story Bridge will be lit Maroon to support Women's State Of Origin Game I and NRL Magic Round.

Enjoy the ultimate Rugby League action-packed long weekend with four days of action at Suncorp Stadium, featuring Game I of the 2024 Women's Ampol State of Origin on Thursday May 16th, plus the 3 day NRL Magic Round from Friday 17 to Sunday 19 May.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

item.title: Eve of World Neurofibromatosis Awareness Day
item.description:
Thursday, May 16, 2024

The Tropical Dome will be lit Green and Blue to support Eve of World Neurofibromatosis Awareness Day.

May 17 is World Neurofibromatosis Awareness Day and the Children’s Tumour Foundation of Australia is joining cities all over the world in lighting up buildings and important landmarks blue and green to help raise awareness of NF. The Children's Tumour Foundation is the patient advocacy and support service for children, adults and families impacted by the genetic condition, neurofibromatosis in Australia.

This Light Up is organised by: Children's Tumour Foundation

Venue: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha
Venue address: Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha, 152 Mt Coot-tha Road, Toowong

item.title: IDAHOBIT
item.description:
Friday, May 17, 2024

The Tropical Dome will be lit rainbow to celebrate IDAHOBIT.

Brisbane City Council - River City Pride  wants to light up Brisbane in celebration and awareness of IDAHOBIT Day 2023.  On May 17, 1990 - the World Health Organization removed homosexuality from the Classification of Diseases and Related Health Problems. While we celebrate this milestone and other advancements in LGBTQIA+ equality, the unfortunate reality is that there's still more work to do.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane City Council - River City Pride 

Venue: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha
Venue address: Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha, 152 Mt Coot-tha Road, Toowong

item.title: Paniyiri
item.description:
Saturday, May 18, 2024

City Hall will be lit Blue and White to celebrate Paniyiri.

Paniyiri is Brisbane's festival of everything Greek, featuring an exciting cultural celebration of food, dance, music, art, cooking, live entertainment and history. An eagerly anticipated annual event, Paniyiri unites the Greek Community of South East Queensland with the general community in a celebration of fun, food and friendship.

This Light Up is organised by: Greek Orthodox Community of St George

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: World IBD Day
item.description:
Sunday, May 19, 2024

The Story Bridge will be lit Purple to support World IBD Day.

For more than three decades, Crohn’s & Colitis Australia has been empowering the more than 100,000 Australian's living with Crohn’s disease or ulcerative colitis collectively known as inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) to live fearlessly. CCA's primary purpose is to provide support services, advice, and encouragement to people with IBD. While we invest in research for a cure, CCA continues to advocate for world best treatments and health services for those living with IBD.

This Light Up is organised by: Crohn's and Colitis Australia

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

item.title: National Palliative Care Week
item.description:
Monday, May 20, 2024

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Orange to support National Palliative Care Week.

National Palliative Care Week (19-25 May 2024) raises awareness for the palliative care sector, including the many benefits of quality palliative care which helps people with life-limiting illnesses to live as well as possible, for as long as possible – supporting their physical, emotional, spiritual, and social needs.

This Light Up is organised by: Palliative Care Queensland

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: National Volunteer Week
item.description:
Tuesday, May 21, 2024

The Story Bridge will be lit Red to support National Volunteer Week.

National Volunteer Week is the premier event which recognises and honours the essential and valuable work and the volunteer-involving organisations that engage them to support the achievement of their purpose and mission. Volunteering Queensland, alongside Volunteering Australia and the other state peak bodies lead the nation in celebrating the important work of volunteers across the country. On May 22nd 2024 the Queensland Volunteering Awards will be held at City Hall in the Main Auditorium.

This Light Up is organised by: Volunteering Queensland

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point
